result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack K. Scherer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jack K. Scherer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jack K. Scherer was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs), Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Jack K. Scherer was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.    Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.   Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.    
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge. 
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Stephanie Scherer or any person under 18 yoa., unless otherwise permitted by the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Inform any treating physician of history of narcotic abuse.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and victim is present in court.  Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 2 - DE is sentenced to 4 years in the WSP forthwith; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 315 days.  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Count 4 - Court imposes and stays 6 months in the KCJ with Huber privileges.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with same conditions as Count 2 and is Consecutive to Count 2. 
No contact with Stephanie S. or any person under 18 yoa unless permitted by the Agent.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
from Atty Olson

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
